Discuss civil rights concerns in your community and learn more about our Campaign for Smart Justice.

Aloha ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Join us on Thursday, October 10 at 6 p.m. at Maui Coffee Attic in Wailuku for a free Talk Story event as part of our Campaign for Smart Justice, which focuses on addressing systemic discrimination and reducing mass incarceration. The campaign aims to increase public safety by being smart on crime, not just tough on crime.

Open to the public, the evening will be an open conversation about the current landscape of civil rights in Hawai'i. We will also discuss some of the ACLUâ€™s recent work in the legislature and the Campaign for Smart Justice initiative. More importantly, we want to hear from you! What are some civil rights concerns in your community? What do you want lawmakers to know? What changes do you wish to see?

Talk-Story Maui

Thursday, October 10, 6 p.m.
Maui Coffee Attic
59 Kanoa St
Wailuku, HI 96793

RSVP TODAY

Food and refreshments will be available. This event is ADA-accessible. For more information or to request special accommodation, email mespita@acluhawaii.org or call 808-522-5906.

Event is open to the public. RSVP today!

Mahalo and we hope to see you on the 10!

ACLU of Hawai'i
